author: KIRO 7 News Seattle
title: Chiefs celebrate with Chris Jones as he gets a sack to hit a big contract incentive ‚Äì KIRO 7 News Seattle
text:
While many of the Kansas City Chiefs key players sat out Sunday's regular-season finale, defensive star Chris Jones was still on the field in the second half.
He had good reason.
Jones needed one sack to hit a seven-figure bonus. Jones would get a $1.25 million bonus if he hit 10 sacks this season. He came into the final game at 9.5 on the season.
In the third quarter, he got his $1.25 million sack. And the Chiefs were well aware. Jones came through the middle and sacked Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Easton Stick. That started a celebration that wasn't just Jones, but most of his teammates. The whole sideline erupted with the sack.
The celebration said plenty about what Jones' teammates think of him.
CHRIS JONES GETS HIS BONUS! The whole @Chiefs sideline was HYPED for him.
üì∫: #KCvsLAC on CBS
üì±: Stream on #NFLPlus https://t.co/X0vcyHUoyR pic.twitter.com/lrapGgskaZ
‚Äî NFL (@NFL) January 7, 2024 A similar scene happened in Baltimore on Saturday, when Ravens edge rusher Jadeveon Clowney got a sack for a big bonus and celebrated it . Remember: Players know what stats they need to hit certain incentives, and often their teammates know too.
Jones was given hugs on the sideline from defensive coordinator Steve Spagnuolo and coach Andy Reid after the sack. Jones' season started with a contract holdout as he sought a large long-term deal. He eventually reported on a new one-year deal after missing the first game of the season. On Sunday, Jones made plenty of money for himself.

author: VNExplorer
title: British film legend, 90, 'to come out of retirement and star in secret new Netflix series' - just two months after he quit work
text:
Veteran British actor Sir Michael Caine is reportedly set to come out of retirement to star in a new Netflix series.
The Sun reports that the icon, 90, has joined a show filming next month of which the details are being kept closely under wraps.
It comes two months after Sir Michael announced that he has decided to retire from acting.
An source told the publication: ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs been asked to star in a Netflix series. Details are kept closely guarded.‚Äô
A representative for Michael and Netflix have been contacted by MailOnline for further comment.
Veteran British actor Sir Michael Caine is reportedly set to come out of retirement to star in a new Netflix series
The Sun reports that the icon, 90, has joined a show filming next month of which the details are being kept closely under wraps
Sir Michael confirmed his retirement decision in October, following a stellar career spanning seven decades and days after the release of his latest film, The Great Escaper.
The talented star ‚Äì who has starred in over 180 movies ‚Äì explained his decision came after he concluded that ‚Äòyou don‚Äôt have leading men at 90.‚Äô
Confirming the news, the beloved thespian told BBC Radio 4‚Äôs Today programme: ‚ÄòI keep saying I‚Äôm going to retire. Well I am now.‚Äô
‚ÄòI‚Äôve figured, I‚Äôve had a picture where I‚Äôve played the lead and had incredible reviews‚Ä¶ What am I going to do that will beat this?‚Äô
The Oscar, Golden Globe and Bafta-winning actor has an extensive filmography, including classic films ranging from Zulu and The Italian Job to more recently in Interstellar and The Dark Knight franchise, alongside Christian Bale.
In his final movie, The Great Escaper which was released on October 6, he plays real-life World War Two veteran Bernie Jordan who escaped from a care home to attend D-Day celebrations in France.
Speaking about his decision to hang up his boots, Sir Michael ‚Äì who has been using a walking stick for five years after a fall on ice and spinal surgery ‚Äì said: ‚ÄòThe only parts I‚Äôm liable to get now are 90-year-old men. Or maybe 85.
‚ÄòThey‚Äôre not going to be the lead. You don‚Äôt have leading men at 90, you‚Äôre going to have young handsome boys and girls. So I thought, I might as well leave with all this.‚Äô
It comes two months after Sir Michael announced that he has decided to retire from acting (seen in 2018)
In his final movie, The Great Escaper which was released on October 6, he plays real-life World War Two veteran Bernie Jordan who escaped from a care home to attend D-Day celebrations
Sir Michael revealed he had turned down appearing in the The Great Escaper three times before accepting the role, because he considered himself retired.
He stars alongside Glenda Jackson, who died in June after the completion of the film.
Sir Michael recently revealed the secret to a long, happy life is to marry a younger woman, stop eating between meals ‚Äì and wear trainers.
In an interview with The Mail on Sunday‚Äôs You Magazine, Sir Michael said his advice for longevity is ‚Äòyounger wives, no snacking and wearing trainers all the time ‚Äì and you have to be careful not to fall down‚Äô.
He married model Shakira, 76, in 1973 after seeing her in a TV advert and tracking her down. She was 26 and he was 40.
They have a daughter Natasha and three grandchildren he says also help to keep him youthful, adding: ‚ÄòYou want to live forever to see what they do with their lives.‚Äô
Sir Michael confirmed his retirement decision in October, following a stellar career spanning seven decades (pictured in 1996 film Alfie)

author: Reuters
title: Estrat√©gia da Petrobras evita repasse de volatidades do petr√≥leo, diz CEO ap√≥s alta do petr√≥leo Por Reuters
text:
Por Rodrigo Viga Gaier
RIO DE JANEIRO (Reuters) - Com sua estrat√©gia comercial, a Petrobras (BVMF: PETR4 ) tem conseguido proporcionar estabilidade de pre√ßos de combust√≠veis aos brasileiros em ambiente de volatilidade externa diante do conflito no Oriente M√©dio, disse nesta quinta-feira a presidente da companhia, Magda Chambriard.
Em entrevista √† Reuters, a executiva afirmou que essa estabilidade √© poss√≠vel com estrat√©gia da Petrobras que passou a incorporar "suas melhores condi√ß√µes de produ√ß√£o e log√≠stica para a defini√ß√£o dos pre√ßos seus de venda de gasolina e diesel √†s distribuidoras".
Essa pol√≠tica comercial, na vis√£o de executiva, permite √† empresa minimizar a volatilidade de pre√ßos, especialmente em momentos de alta do barril do petr√≥leo como os registrados recentemente, com o conflito no Oriente M√©dio fazendo os pre√ßos do petr√≥leo dispararem ap√≥s um per√≠odo de queda.
"Isso nos permite praticar pre√ßos competitivos frente a outras alternativas de suprimento e mitigar a volatilidade do mercado internacional", afirmou ela.
Os pre√ßos do petr√≥leo Brent , uma das vari√°veis acompanhadas pela Petrobras para definir a valor das vendas de diesel e gasolina, saltaram 5% nesta quinta-feira, para fechar a 77,62 d√≥lares o barril, diante de preocupa√ß√µes de que o conflito regional crescente no Oriente M√©dio possa interromper fluxos globais de petr√≥leo.
A Petrobras mexeu no pre√ßo da gasolina pela √∫ltima vez em julho, ao elevar em cerca de 7% o valor para as distribuidoras, no primeiro ajuste em oito meses. No diesel, a companhia n√£o alterou as cota√ß√µes √†s distribuidoras este ano.
Ela lembrou, citando o diretor de Log√≠stica Comercializa√ß√£o e Mercados, Claudio Schlosser, que no passado a Petrobras j√° praticou reajustes di√°rios, passando toda a volatilidade das cota√ß√µes internacionais e do c√¢mbio para os pre√ßos internos.
"Hoje, isso n√£o ocorre. N√≥s consideramos nossas melhores condi√ß√µes de produ√ß√£o nacional de petr√≥leo, parque de refino, terminais, dutos, navios etc, para sermos competitivos com as principais alternativas de suprimento dos nossos clientes e, importante frisar, sem repassar o nervosismo di√°rio das cota√ß√µes internacionais e do c√¢mbio", destacou.
Ela ressalvou, contudo, que a Petrobras segue observando "os eventos recentes e eventuais desdobramentos sobre os fundamentos de mercado", ao comentar o conflito entre Israel e Ir√£ e sua influ√™ncia nos pre√ßos internacionais.
Mas disse que, "por quest√µes concorrenciais, n√£o pode antecipar suas decis√µes".
(Por Rodrigo Viga Gaier)

author: @prokerala
title: Siddaramaiah's remark on Rahul as PM face likely to trigger infighting in K'taka Cong
text: Bengaluru, Dec 28 : Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's statement that Rahul Gandhi is leading the country and will become the Prime Minister after the Lok Sabha elections next year is likely to trigger internal fight in state Congress, sources said on Thursday. Siddaramaiah made the statement on Thursday while addressing the 139th Foundation Day of the party at the Bharat Jodo auditorium in Bengaluru. Sources said the remarks might trigger a rift between AICC President Mallikarjun Kharge and Siddaramaiah. It may be noted that Kharge's name was proposed as the PM face by West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee during the INDIA bloc meeting held in the national capital recently. Siddaramaiah had distanced himself from giving his opinion on the proposal to make Kharge the PM face. "Mamta Banerjee had suggested his (Kharge's) name... It is to be seen whom the INDIA bloc makes its PM face," Siddaramaiah had stated. Commenting on the Congress President's name being proposed as the PM face, Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge, the son of Mallikarjun Kharge, questioned why discussions always revolve around community and whether efficiency in Dalits is not considered. He made this statement in response to queries as to if the name of a senior Dalit leader like Kharge had been put up to give an advantage to the INDIA bloc in the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections. Priyank Kharge maintained that every time there are discussions about a Chief Ministerial or Prime Ministerial candidate, they tend to focus on communities. "Won't you see efficiency in these communities that you are mentioning? Will they only get elected in the name of the communities they belong to," he asked. Sources said that questions are already being raised over Siddaramaiah not supporting the proposal of Kharge's candidature for the PM post whole-heartedly.

author: NTN24
title: El ‚ÄòDibu‚Äô Mart√≠nez manda a silenciar a los fan√°ticos que lo silbaban con atajada imposible de un penalti en Francia | NTN24.COM
text: [Dibu Mart√≠nez](/temas/dibu-martinez) El ‚ÄòDibu‚Äô Mart√≠nez manda a silenciar a los fan√°ticos que lo silbaban con atajada imposible de un penalti en Francia El portero argentino Emiliano ‚ÄòEl Dibu‚Äô Mart√≠nez tuvo una jornada destacada este jueves 18 de abril en el partido que enfrent√≥ a su club, el Aston Villa de Inglaterra, ante el Lille de Francia por los cuartos de final de la Conference League. Mart√≠nez, a lo largo del partido en el que cada vez que tocaba el bal√≥n era silbado, ejecut√≥ varias atajadas de primer nivel durante el desarrollo del encuentro que tuvo que decidirse desde los penales debido a que la serie qued√≥ empatada 3 a 3. Fue en ese momento en el que los abucheos en contra del Dibu subieron los decibeles en un estadio que le cobraba su papel en la final del Mundial de Qatar 2022 en donde fue clave para que la selecci√≥n de Argentina se impusiera a Francia. Los silbidos no hicieron m√°s que aumentar la concentraci√≥n del argentino quien en la serie ataj√≥ dos disparos. Sus paradas le permitieron al Aston Villa ganar la tanda de penales por 4 a 3 para as√≠ avanzar a las semifinales del campeonato. El ‚ÄòDibu‚Äô despu√©s de la primera atajada hizo un gesto con el que evidentemente mand√≥ a callar a los aficionados del Lille. Luego, en la segunda atajada en lo que era el quinto penal, el argentino se gir√≥ y bail√≥ enfrente de la tribuna. De esa manera respondi√≥ a un p√∫blico que no tuvo indulgencia con quien fue el gran villano en la final de su pa√≠s ante Argentina hace poco m√°s de un a√±o. Aston Villa busca en la Conference League ganar su primer t√≠tulo europeo en m√°s de cuatro d√©cadas. El equipo de Unai Emery gan√≥ el partido de ida por 2 a 1 la semana pasada, pero el Lille igual√≥ la eliminatoria con un resultado id√©ntico a su favor este jueves. El Aston Villa, que marcha cuarto en la Premier League de Inglaterra, jugar√° las semifinales del torneo europeo el pr√≥ximo 2 y 9 de mayo.
